name: Sadat Khoram
story: Khalil Wardak hails from the rugged mountains of southern Afghanistan, near the border with Pakistan. He served in the Taliban during the 90s and early 2000s, but after the fall of the regime, he joined various anti-government factions to continue his fight in what he saw as the ongoing resistance against foreign occupation. He now serves as a private in the OPFOR army, using his experience as a seasoned guerrilla fighter to strike at the heart of the enemy's defenses.
